intro: Goniothalamus gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed goniothalamus, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berry-like, containing a single seed, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
